Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

Our customer offers automobile, homeowners, and other personal lines of insurance to members across 23 states and the District of Columbia. For decades, they’ve brought peace of mind to members by looking to protect their belongings, find solutions to problems, settle claims and get their lives back on track. With more than 100 years of history, our Customer is one of the most trusted brands in America.
Our customer is looking for an IT Security Analyst / Engineer on a contract basis to help support their ongoing business needs. The role will act as a Cyber and Data Protection analyst, as well as performing operational tasks daily. This role works closely with Cyber Protection Engineering, business teams, and infrastructure/platform teams to identify, track, and remediate open cyber risks for both cloud and systems in company-owned data centers.

What You’ll Do:
Ability to support and provide analysis for Host (End-Point), Network, and Data Protection security platforms and applications.

Actively participates in project activities, improvement of procedures and standards, and document Standard Operating Procedures or Runbooks.

Design, implement, and document, standard operating procedures for specific security tools, and technologies.

Collaborates with workstream engineers to create metrics, KPI’s and dashboards for on-demand and scheduled periodic reporting.

Writes situational analyses for high-risk threats and suggests appropriate courses of action for remediation.

Able to present technical and security concepts to non-technical audiences.

Fosters and maintains relationships with key stakeholders and our client IT units.

Assists in proactively developing security best practices procedures and processes within the security operations team and in conjunction with business and IT partners.

Analyze security toolset gaps, provide the problem statement, and supply requirements to Security Architecture for solution design.

Evangelize security within the business, IT teams, and be an advocate for customer trust.

Compile and analyze data for management reporting and metrics.

Able to be flexible and adaptable in an Agile working environment and be able to provide Security Analysis and Engineering capabilities.


Minimum 3 years operational experience with Cyber and Data Protection, Network Protection, and Endpoint Protection tools: for example - Qualys Configuration Manager, Tripwire, McAfee, MS Security tools, layer 2 firewalls, Web Application Firewalls, Microsoft Information Protection, etc.

Technical knowledge in security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, and application security.

Development experience in C#, C++, Java, Python, or Linux scripting is a plus.

Solid understanding of various operating systems such as Microsoft Windows, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Solaris, etc.

Overall knowledge of application development and Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP).

Certification(s) in industry-adopted security expertise areas such as Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), or Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) preferred

Knowledge of forensics, network analysis, log analysis, systems hardening, encryption technologies, certificates, mobile, and web application security.

Proficient in troubleshooting, advanced debugging, and root cause analysis skills.

Knowledge in security engineering, network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, and application security.

Excellent written and oral communications skills.

Ability to write technical and non-technical documentation desired.


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical discipline.

ABOUT US: Referentia Systems Incorporated has a proven track record for successfully developing innovative advanced computing solutions to meet critical needs for the U.S. Department of Defense, and transitioning those technologies to the commercial sector. With more than 15 years of experience in cybersecurity and cross-domain solutions for the DoD, Referentia is a leader for DoD’s enclaving strategy. We have created eResilience, our newest division, to commercialize Referentia’s cybersecurity expertise and innovation. See eResilience.com for more information.
eRESILIENCE IS WORKING TO HELP SAVE THE WORLD – REALLY!
The United States of America is one of the world’s leading sources of innovation, but our country – including government, military, and industry, is under constant attack from cyber criminals. eResilience is a leader in the fight against cyber threats and if you have in-depth experience in RMF/CSF/NIST and share our values, then WE NEED YOU! We are working to accelerate the RMF and the ATO process for the DoD and apply similar techniques for the Defense Industrial Base (DIB) and its supply chain. We have an immediate need for experienced cybersecurity and project management professionals to support the DoD RMF Mission. We all share our core values of leadership/proactive, customer focused, innovation, professional knowledge, integrity, spirit of aloha/teamwork, and humility. Ready for a job with meaning? If you want to use your skills and training to do something important, send your resume and apply today.

Role: Information Security Analyst
Overview of the Role and Organization

The candidate will also help develop organization wide best practices for IT security.

About S2:
S2 eliminates risks of separate red- and blue-teams by creating continuously optimized cybersecurity for the modern, constant-threat landscape. Our centralized adversary simulation, detection and response platform, Mage, uses advanced tradecraft to provide continuous red team-as-a-service. With Mage, we find weaknesses before adversaries do, so that every threat is an opportunity for improvement. Deployed as-a-service, S2 makes advanced real-time cybersecurity accessible for all organizations. With smart automation and continuous testing, we help you focus on the most imminent and most critical risks to your enterprise.
S2 is a Small Business that is focused solely on cybersecurity and specializes in Adversary Simulation, Protection and Prevention services. We were founded by cybersecurity experts trained by the National Security Agency (NSA) who were joined by senior cybersecurity entrepreneurs with proven expertise within the Federal Government. We are a growing community of cyber professionals seeking like-minded individuals who are passionate about cybersecurity, seek innovation in our everyday work, hold ourselves and those around us accountable, and have a will to win.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

About UIT: University Information Technology (UIT), the central IT service provider for campus, reports to the Chief Information Officer and is responsible for many of the University of Utah’s most critical common IT resources including the campus network; the Campus Information Services (CIS) portal; UMail, telephone, and online collaboration services; high performance and research computing; information security; software licensing; and a host of other systems and services. About the University: Located in Salt Lake City, in the foothills of the Wasatch Mountains, the University of Utah is the flagship institution of the State of Utah’s system of higher education and a member of the PAC-12 Conference. Salt Lake City combines the amenities of a major metropolitan area of more than one million people with the friendliness and ease of living of a small, Western city. Seven major ski resorts are within an hour’s drive from campus, and opportunities to pursue activities from biking to hiking to fishing abound. Salt Lake is also home to the Utah Symphony and Opera, the Utah Ballet, several professional sports teams, and a wide range of other cultural and recreational activities.

About S2:
S2 eliminates risks of separate red- and blue-teams by creating continuously optimized cybersecurity for the modern, constant-threat landscape. Our centralized adversary simulation, detection and response platform, Mage, uses advanced tradecraft to provide continuous red team-as-a-service. With Mage, we find weaknesses before adversaries do, so that every threat is an opportunity for improvement. Deployed as-a-service, S2 makes advanced real-time cybersecurity accessible for all organizations. With smart automation and continuous testing, we help you focus on the most imminent and most critical risks to your enterprise.

We are a growing community of cyber professionals seeking like-minded individuals who are passionate about cybersecurity, seek innovation in our everyday work, hold ourselves and those around us accountable, and have a will to win.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Please note: This position does not offer remote work options and will work onsite at our Administration Building located in Spokane Valley, WA.

Additionally, this position will serve as a security champion to help raise security awareness and promote a positive security culture within the credit union.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Information Security Analyst is a crucial role in that it provides hands-on technical expertise to the Information Technology department of the firm. This position is responsible for monitoring the information security environment to immediately detect, verify and respond swiftly to cyber threats, e.g. vulnerability exploitation, malware, cyber-attacks, etc. This role effectively enhances the incident response operations of the organization by working closely with IT and business stakeholders to execute in a non-disruptive manner across the firm. Working in conjunction with our IT Trainer, IT Support, and IT Systems Teams, this position will be a key contributor in executing the firm’s Cybersecurity strategy and the creation of security processes relative to threat intelligence, security monitoring, security automation, and security awareness.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

We are looking for security analysts who will work in a SOC (security operations center) environment, working with various teams to identify and help resolve security vulnerabilities in a line of business' various applications and platforms.

Solid understanding of information security
Test systems with the aim of finding vulnerabilities and exploits
4+ years of experience in vulnerability assessment
Scripting experience (Python, Powershell, shell scripting)
Competent with commercial and open source vulnerability testing frameworks and tools (such as Burp Suite, Metasploit, Kali, Nessus, etc.)
Good OS knowledge (Unix, Linux, Windows)
Solid understanding of networking protocols
Understanding of and experience of frameworks, coding stacks and automated tools to be able to find exploits
Experience documenting vulnerabilities and remediation
Conduct assessments
Develop custom tools and scripts for penetration testing
Stay informed via forums, vendor updates and other sources
Provide security coverage and support for new business and technology initiatives
Excellent communication skills

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

The security risk analyst is responsible for executing audits to ensure compliance with Jackson Healthcare’s security risk management program. The individual in this position is responsible for identifying, evaluating and reporting on information security risks in a manner that meets Jackson Healthcare’s regulatory and other compliance requirements. The security risk analyst works proactively with the various business units and organizations to implement practices that meet Jackson Healthcare’s defined policies and standards for information risk management.
The security risk analyst will assist in creating and executing the processes for all of Jackson Healthcare’s IT-related risk assessment and identification activities, for the company's IT systems and information assets and for its IT-dependent strategic business objectives. The security risk analyst must possess in-depth knowledge of Jackson Healthcare’s business environment, to ensure the company's IT systems are appropriately protected and fully functional.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Collect, consolidate, research, analyze, and correlate internal (firewalls, network devices, servers, databases, applications) and external threat intelligence to detect anomalies

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

About S2:
S2 eliminates risks of separate red- and blue-teams by creating continuously optimized cybersecurity for the modern, constant-threat landscape. Our centralized adversary simulation, detection and response platform, Mage, uses advanced tradecraft to provide continuous red team-as-a-service. With Mage, we find weaknesses before adversaries do, so that every threat is an opportunity for improvement. Deployed as-a-service, S2 makes advanced real-time cybersecurity accessible for all organizations. With smart automation and continuous testing, we help you focus on the most imminent and most critical risks to your enterprise.
S2 is a Small Business that is focused solely on cybersecurity and specializes in Adversary Simulation, Protection and Prevention services. We were founded by cybersecurity experts trained by the National Security Agency (NSA) who were joined by senior cybersecurity entrepreneurs with proven expertise within the Federal Government. ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

JOB DECRIPTION:
The primary function of an IIT Security & Vulnerability Analyst is to plan, coordinate, and implement company approved security measures for information systems. Regulate access to computer data files and prevent unauthorized deletion, modification, destruction or disclosure of information. A typical IT Security & Vulnerability Analyst is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing security measures to safeguard the IS data and infrastructure.
Job Responsibilities:
Identify security vulnerabilities, issues and risks, and develop sustainable mitigation plans. Architect, design, implement, support, and evaluate security tools and services. Develop and integrate security policies and procedures to sustain remediation efforts. Adhere to security compliance standards. Develop and deliver security training materials, perform security awareness training . Evaluate, recommend and implement new security products.

The IT Security Analyst will serve as the process owner for all ongoing activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the member, provider, employee and business information in compliance with Monogram Health’s information security policies and procedures.. This role will be expected to build incident investigation workflows for the different types of security incidents/scenarios, this includes being able to explain the root cause of an incident or a breach from start to end and the ability to document a security incident/breach and the damage it caused. You will be expected to continually adapt in order to stay a step ahead of cyber attackers by staying on top of cybersecurity trends. This is a team-oriented group that works together to implement countermeasures based on incident investigation findings and research. The right person for the role will be curious, creative and highly interested in the latest security developments.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Information Security Analyst is a crucial role in that it provides hands-on technical expertise to the Information Technology department of the firm. This position is responsible for monitoring the information security environment to immediately detect, verify and respond swiftly to cyber threats, e.g. vulnerability exploitation, malware, cyber-attacks, etc. This role effectively enhances the incident response operations of the organization by working closely with IT and business stakeholders to execute in a non-disruptive manner across the firm. Working in conjunction with our IT Trainer, IT Support, and IT Systems Teams, this position will be a key contributor in executing the firm’s Cybersecurity strategy and the creation of security processes relative to threat intelligence, security monitoring, security automation, and security awareness.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

The SOC analyst will research current attack trends and methodologies, tracking sources of malware and being able to identify how network infrastructure may have been compromised. They will communicate effectively within the team and work cooperatively with the Tyler Detect Lead Analysts, Senior Analysts, Threat Analysts, and Team Managers to ensure the highest quality and timely reporting to the Tyler Detect client base. The Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst position is also responsible for surveilling and responding to real time security event alerts by performing log analysis investigations. This will occasionally involve working off hours shifts.
Primary working hours: 7:00AM – 3:30PM.
Monthly rotating shifts are:
Monday: 7:00AM - 3:30PM, Tuesday - Friday: 11:30AM – 8:00PM

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

The Cybersecurity Analyst contribute to the support of cybersecurity operations by designing, developing or recommending secure technical solutions, including policy, standards, applications, systems, architectures, and infrastructure that are operationally viable and efficient. -Contribute to the design of cybersecurity toolsets to enable more automated discovery, remediation, and alerting of network and device vulnerabilities, as a means of improving the security posture. -Perform analysis of emerging technologies and design and build architectures and solutions to enable secure implementation of new technologies. -Contribute to the development of a risk-based cyber security program which meets regulatory requirements and aligns with industry leading information security practices. -Perform threat identification and mitigation activities using industry leading security controls and tools sets. -Assess threats to the business and deploy countermeasures for those threats. -Guide business units, application development teams, and third-party vendors to achieve program requirements while enabling the business. -Apply technical knowledge to protect the Company against cyber threats (e.g., knowledge of firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, data loss prevention solutions, endpoint protections, log aggregation technology and other leading-edge security technologies).

The Information Security Analyst is a crucial role in that it provides hands-on technical expertise to the Information Technology department of the firm. This position is responsible for monitoring the information security environment to immediately detect, verify and respond swiftly to cyber threats, e.g. vulnerability exploitation, malware, cyber-attacks, etc. This role effectively enhances the incident response operations of the organization by working closely with IT and business stakeholders to execute in a non-disruptive manner across the firm. Working in conjunction with our IT Trainer, IT Support, and IT Systems Teams, this position will be a key contributor in executing the firm’s Cybersecurity strategy and the creation of security processes relative to threat intelligence, security monitoring, security automation, and security awareness.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

This role leads initiatives in risk, product security, or security operations. They are responsible for assisting in developing, executing, auditing, and maintaining security controls, defenses, and countermeasures to intercept and prevent attempts to infiltrate company data. This challenging position will work closely with all departments and 3rd Party Vendors to ensure baseline security for the organization
What You’ll Enjoy:
Full benefits package including medical, dental, and 401k plans
Paid holidays and Open Paid Time Off (PTO) policy to ensure a solid work/life balance
Paid time off to volunteer during company hours for qualifying nonprofit organizations
Comprehensive parental leave, adoption assistance, and pet insurance programs

By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

Working in conjunction with our IT Trainer, IT Support, and IT Systems Teams, this position will be a key contributor in executing the firm’s Cybersecurity strategy and the creation of security processes relative to threat intelligence, security monitoring, security automation, and security awareness.

ADP is hiring an Associate Cybersecurity Analyst

As Associate Cybersecurity Analyst you will join a highly skilled team providing world-class network security assessments and consultation for ADP's Global Security Organization (GSO). This team is responsible for the execution of ADP’s global Compliance and Vulnerability Management Program (CVM) program across Cloud and on-premise data centers. Services provided to the organization include: Server & Cloud Compliance including vulnerability management & zero-day vulnerability response as well as secure OS build compliance.
You will focus on supporting server & cloud compliance processes in a large, complex environment by leveraging a variety of security tools and databases. Working closely with various product and technology teams, you will ensure our infrastructure meets and maintains the requirements of our compliance and vulnerability management program.
To succeed in this position, you’ll need a fundamental understanding of server operating systems as well as general understanding of data center and/or cloud infrastructure. Balance that with a desire to learn about new exploits, threats and security trends in a rapidly changing environment to help support the CVM program.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

About S2:
S2 eliminates risks of separate red- and blue-teams by creating continuously optimized cybersecurity for the modern, constant-threat landscape. Our centralized adversary simulation, detection and response platform, Mage, uses advanced tradecraft to provide continuous red team-as-a-service. With Mage, we find weaknesses before adversaries do, so that every threat is an opportunity for improvement. Deployed as-a-service, S2 makes advanced real-time cybersecurity accessible for all organizations. With smart automation and continuous testing, we help you focus on the most imminent and most critical risks to your enterprise.
S2 is a Small Business that is focused solely on cybersecurity and specializes in Adversary Simulation, Protection and Prevention services. We were founded by cybersecurity experts trained by the National Security Agency (NSA) who were joined by senior cybersecurity entrepreneurs with proven expertise within the Federal Government. We are a growing community of cyber professionals seeking like-minded individuals who are passionate about cybersecurity, seek innovation in our everyday work, hold ourselves and those around us accountable, and have a will to win.

Description
The security risk analyst is responsible for executing audits to ensure compliance with Jackson Healthcare’s security risk management program. The individual in this position is responsible for identifying, evaluating and reporting on information security risks in a manner that meets Jackson Healthcare’s regulatory and other compliance requirements. The security risk analyst works proactively with the various business units and organizations to implement practices that meet Jackson Healthcare’s defined policies and standards for information risk management.
The security risk analyst will assist in creating and executing the processes for all of Jackson Healthcare’s IT-related risk assessment and identification activities, for the company's IT systems and information assets and for its IT-dependent strategic business objectives. The security risk analyst must possess in-depth knowledge of Jackson Healthcare’s business environment, to ensure the company's IT systems are appropriately protected and fully functional.

The IT Security Analyst will serve as the process owner for all ongoing activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the member, provider, employee and business information in compliance with Monogram Health’s information security policies and procedures.. This role will be expected to build incident investigation workflows for the different types of security incidents/scenarios, this includes being able to explain the root cause of an incident or a breach from start to end and the ability to document a security incident/breach and the damage it caused. You will be expected to continually adapt in order to stay a step ahead of cyber attackers by staying on top of cybersecurity trends. This is a team-oriented group that works together to implement countermeasures based on incident investigation findings and research. The right person for the role will be curious, creative and highly interested in the latest security developments.

Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

Description
The security risk analyst is responsible for executing audits to ensure compliance with Jackson Healthcare’s security risk management program. The individual in this position is responsible for identifying, evaluating and reporting on information security risks in a manner that meets Jackson Healthcare’s regulatory and other compliance requirements. The security risk analyst works proactively with the various business units and organizations to implement practices that meet Jackson Healthcare’s defined policies and standards for information risk management.
The security risk analyst will assist in creating and executing the processes for all of Jackson Healthcare’s IT-related risk assessment and identification activities, for the company's IT systems and information assets and for its IT-dependent strategic business objectives. The security risk analyst must possess in-depth knowledge of Jackson Healthcare’s business environment, to ensure the company's IT systems are appropriately protected and fully functional.

The IT Security Analyst will serve as the process owner for all ongoing activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the member, provider, employee and business information in compliance with Monogram Health’s information security policies and procedures.. This role will be expected to build incident investigation workflows for the different types of security incidents/scenarios, this includes being able to explain the root cause of an incident or a breach from start to end and the ability to document a security incident/breach and the damage it caused. You will be expected to continually adapt in order to stay a step ahead of cyber attackers by staying on top of cybersecurity trends. This is a team-oriented group that works together to implement countermeasures based on incident investigation findings and research. The right person for the role will be curious, creative and highly interested in the latest security developments.

The Information Security Analyst will join the Tech Team at our headquarters in Centennial, CO. They will assist with ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of FAST’s internal systems and hosted client applications within a hosted infrastructure. The responsibilities include maintaining and improving the security and compliance program for FAST’s hosted customers.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Information Security Analyst is a crucial role in that it provides hands-on technical expertise to the Information Technology department of the firm. This position is responsible for monitoring the information security environment to immediately detect, verify and respond swiftly to cyber threats, e.g. vulnerability exploitation, malware, cyber-attacks, etc. This role effectively enhances the incident response operations of the organization by working closely with IT and business stakeholders to execute in a non-disruptive manner across the firm. Working in conjunction with our IT Trainer, IT Support, and IT Systems Teams, this position will be a key contributor in executing the firm’s Cybersecurity strategy and the creation of security processes relative to threat intelligence, security monitoring, security automation, and security awareness.

Support: Provide analysis, status reporting and oversight on any number of global remediation campaigns Risk Management: Evaluate risks/vulnerabilities to prioritize and mitigate them. Welcome to Riscure!
At Riscure, we help our customers to make Mallory go elsewhere. By looking for security vulnerabilities in devices, chipsets, firmware or software applications we help to protect brands and reputations, maintain consumer confidence, and avoid costly product recalls. We’re proud that manufacturers of mobile phones, smart meters, automotive subsystems and payment technology all rely on Riscure’s expertise. Our teams of technical and academic professionals are scattered all around the world, with office locations throughout the US, Europe, and Asia.
What does a day at Riscure look like?
We evaluate the security of the newest products that use embedded and smart card technologies, usually in teams of 2-4 security analysts. The main activities of the evaluation process include analyzing and learning about a device’s specifications, code or hardware, and locating the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. We advise clients as we test their products through critical parts of their development cycle or in the form of a detailed report at the end of a more standard evaluation.

Discovery is at the heart of everything we do. Wherever you find us around the world, if you can think of a product, you can probably find it in our stores, which include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, Winners, Homesense, and TK Maxx. With variety comes plenty of happy surprises—our environment is ever-changing, and that’s just how we like it. Every day is an opportunity to discover something new about our business, our partnerships and even something exciting about yourself. Ready to Discover Different?

About S2:

Description
The security risk analyst is responsible for executing audits to ensure compliance with Jackson Healthcare’s security risk management program. The individual in this position is responsible for identifying, evaluating and reporting on information security risks in a manner that meets Jackson Healthcare’s regulatory and other compliance requirements. The security risk analyst works proactively with the various business units and organizations to implement practices that meet Jackson Healthcare’s defined policies and standards for information risk management.
The security risk analyst will assist in creating and executing the processes for all of Jackson Healthcare’s IT-related risk assessment and identification activities, for the company's IT systems and information assets and for its IT-dependent strategic business objectives. The security risk analyst must possess in-depth knowledge of Jackson Healthcare’s business environment, to ensure the company's IT systems are appropriately protected and fully functional.

The IT Security Analyst will serve as the process owner for all ongoing activities related to the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the member, provider, employee and business information in compliance with Monogram Health’s information security policies and procedures.. This role will be expected to build incident investigation workflows for the different types of security incidents/scenarios, this includes being able to explain the root cause of an incident or a breach from start to end and the ability to document a security incident/breach and the damage it caused. You will be expected to continually adapt in order to stay a step ahead of cyber attackers by staying on top of cybersecurity trends. This is a team-oriented group that works together to implement countermeasures based on incident investigation findings and research. The right person for the role will be curious, creative and highly interested in the latest security developments.
